snippet: In arguing to maintain high bail, a prosecutor said wealthy clients of Anna Gristina may have “an interest in not allowing this case to go forward” and could help her flee.
abstract: Manhattan prosecutors accusing Anna Gristina of running a brothel for wealthy clients from her Manhattan apartment say she is a flight risk; Gristina is being held on Rikers Island, unable to make bail set at $1 million cash or $2 million bond; charge of promoting prostitution is a felony that carries a maximum sentence of seven years in prison.

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and COLIN MOYNIHAN
byline.contributor: Randy Leonard and William K. Rashbaum contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: In arguing to maintain high bail, a prosecutor said wealthy clients of Anna Gristina may have “an interest in not allowing this case to go forward” and could help her flee.

headline.seo: Woman Charged as Madam Has Powerful Ties, Prosecutor Tells Judge
headline.main: Charged as Madam, and Defended as Entrepreneur and Pig Rescuer
headline.print_headline: Charged as Madam, and Defended as Entrepreneur and Pig Rescuer
